summary: Conversion-focused marketing website for 'HR Buddy', an AI-powered recruitment assistant platform targeting small and medium-sized businesses. The site helps companies automate CV screening, shortlist candidates faster, and make data-driven hiring decisions. Key sections include: hero, features (AI candidate analysis, smart shortlisting, bias-reduction, hiring insights), testimonials, success metrics, partner mentions, and CTAs for free trial sign-up.
architectural_notes: Website name is 'HR Buddy'; target audience is HR teams, hiring managers, and SMBs new to AI tools
Design should feel simple, trustworthy, and approachable — avoid overly technical or intimidating AI language

existing_features.title: Build a full-page, conversion-focused marketing website for 'HR Buddy', an AI-powered recruitment assistant platform targeting small and medium-sized businesses. The site must be a single-page React application with smooth scroll navigation between sections.

Implement a sticky top navigation bar with the HR Buddy logo/wordmark on the left, navigation links (Features, How It Works, Testimonials, Pricing, Contact) in the center, and a 'Start Free Trial' CTA button on the right.

Create a bold hero section with a large headline emphasizing speed and accuracy (e.g., 'Hire Smarter. Screen Faster. Decide with Confidence.'), a supporting sub-headline describing the platform value for SMBs, a primary 'Start Free Trial' CTA button, and a secondary 'See How It Works' link. Display a hero illustration or mockup image showing the HR Buddy dashboard.

Build a 'Key Features' section with four feature cards covering: (1) AI Candidate Analysis — intelligent CV parsing and scoring; (2) Smart Shortlisting — automated ranking of top candidates; (3) Bias-Reduction Tools — anonymised screening for fair evaluation; (4) Hiring Insights — clear dashboards and data-driven recommendations. Each card should include an icon, a short title, and a 2–3 sentence description.

Add a 'How It Works' section with a 3-step process flow: Step 1 — Upload CVs and define your job criteria; Step 2 — HR Buddy's AI screens, ranks, and shortlists candidates automatically; Step 3 — Review your curated shortlist and make confident hiring decisions. Display steps horizontally on desktop with numbered indicators and connecting arrows.

Create a 'Success Metrics' section displaying 3–4 key statistics in large, bold numbers to reinforce platform credibility. Use realistic placeholder metrics such as: '75% Faster Screening', '10,000+ Candidates Processed', '92% Hiring Manager Satisfaction', '3x More Shortlisting Accuracy'. Display in a horizontally spaced banner row.

Build a 'Testimonials' section with 3 testimonial cards featuring a quote, the reviewer's name, job title, and company name. Testimonials should reflect hiring managers and HR professionals from SMBs who found HR Buddy easy to use and effective.
Add a 'Trusted Partners' / 'As Seen In' section displaying 5–6 placeholder company logo badges (greyscale) arranged in a horizontal row to reinforce credibility and enterprise trust.

Implement a mid-page conversion CTA section with a high-contrast background, a compelling headline (e.g., 'Ready to Transform Your Hiring Process?'), a short supporting sentence, and a large 'Start Your Free Trial' primary button alongside a 'Schedule a Demo' secondary button.

Build a simple email capture / free trial sign-up section with a centered form containing a single email input field and a 'Get Early Access' submit button. On submission, show an inline success message ('Thanks! We'll be in touch soon.'). Store submitted emails in the Motoko backend.

Create a footer with the HR Buddy logo/wordmark, a short tagline, navigation links grouped into columns (Product, Company, Resources, Legal), social media icon links (LinkedIn, Twitter/X), and a copyright line.

Apply a professional, trustworthy visual theme throughout the site: use a clean off-white/light grey background, deep slate/charcoal for body text, a rich teal or forest green as the primary accent for CTAs and highlights, and warm amber/gold as a secondary accent for icons and badges. Typography should use a modern sans-serif pairing (e.g., a heavier weight for headings, regular weight for body). Maintain generous whitespace and clear visual hierarchy throughout all sections.

Add a 'Schedule a Demo' booking form section to the page. The form should collect the visitor's full name, work email address, company name, team size (dropdown: 1–10, 11–50, 51–200, 200+), and a preferred contact time (text or dropdown). Include a 'Book My Demo' submit button. On successful submission, display an inline confirmation message such as 'Thanks! A member of our team will reach out shortly to confirm your demo.' The form should be accessible via the 'Schedule a Demo' button in the CTA section (smooth scroll) and linked from the navbar.
Add a React Query mutation hook `useSubmitDemoRequest` in `frontend/src/hooks/useQueries.ts` that calls the backend `submitDemoRequest` method, mirroring the existing `useCaptureEmail` pattern.

new_feature_requests.summary: Hero section with bold headline emphasizing speed and accuracy, and primary CTA (free trial)
Features section highlighting AI candidate analysis, smart shortlisting, bias-reduction tools, and hiring insights
Testimonials and success metrics section for social proof and credibility
Partner/client mentions section to reinforce trust
Multiple CTAs throughout the page encouraging free trial sign-up or learn more
Professional color palette with subtle accents and clean visual hierarchy
Responsive, conversion-focused layout with balanced typography and spacing
Interactive demo request / booking form so visitors can schedule a trial directly from the site

Store demo booking submissions in the Motoko backend. Add a `DemoRequest` record type with fields: name (Text), email (Text), company (Text), teamSize (Text), preferredTime (Text), and submittedAt (Int timestamp). Expose a `submitDemoRequest` update method that validates the email is non-empty and stores the record, and a `getAllDemoRequests` query method that returns all stored requests.
